New Records: India posted their second-highest T20 score of 196 without any of their top five scoring fifties, the highest being 208 against New Zealand in February 2019.
Key Match Events: Hardik Pandya scored a fifty and had a solid outing with the ball.
Tanzid Hasan dismissed Virat Kohli and Suryakumar Yadav in the space of three balls.
Kuldeep Yadav's legspin was unplayable, taking multiple wickets.
Jasprit Bumrah's exceptional performance against right-hand batters in the T20 World Cup 2024.
Hardik Pandya's crucial wicket of Litton Das with a slower ball.
Rishad Hossain's impressive bowling, including a key wicket of Shivam Dube.
Rohit Sharma provided a good start with four boundaries in 11 balls.
Rishabh Pant's quick scoring before getting out to a reverse sweep.
Pre-Game Insights: Najmul Hossain Shanto mentioned the wind and expected a score of 150-160 to be good on the pitch.
Rohit Sharma was happy to bat first, expecting the pitch to slow up as the sun beats down.
India's unchanged team included key players like Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli, and Jasprit Bumrah.
Bangladesh made one change with Jaker Ali coming in for Taskin.
Post-Match Reflections: Hardik Pandya's all-round performance was crucial for India's win.
Kuldeep Yadav's legspin was a gamechanger for India.
Bangladesh's captain Najmul Hossain Shanto tried to keep his team in the game but fell short.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match had a party atmosphere with dancers and colorful costumes despite a small crowd.
The weather was humid with possible thunderstorms forecasted.
The crosswinds were a key element in the match, affecting both batting and bowling.
